name: Wittenberg Mountain

trails_config.name: Wittenberg Trail
trails_config.description: Considered one of the finest viewpoints in the Catskills. The summit ledge provides an iconic, unobstructed view of the Ashokan Reservoir.

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New York's premier peaks, Wittenberg Mountain rises to 3780 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 3780 feet, Wittenberg Mountain is a standout peak in New York. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Wittenberg Trail**, a **8.0 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **local peak challenge**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Slide Mountain**, which is just 1.9 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.

data_sources.verified_by: New York State Department of Environmental Conservation (NYS DEC)
data_sources.elevation_source: USGS Benchmark - Wittenberg Mountain Summit (3,780 ft)
data_sources.distance_source: NYS DEC trail guides and Catskill 3500 Club
data_sources.notes: Elevation (3,780 ft) from USGS benchmark. Part of famous 'Burroughs Range Traverse' with Cornell and Slide. Trail distance from NYS DEC and Catskill 3500 Club guides. Part of Catskill High Peaks.
